titleInfo.title: Yes This Night We Part Forever

mods.note: This piece of sheet music is included in a bound volume that once belonged to Miss Nora Gardner, a Tennessee resident. It is inscribed in pencil at the top of the cover page to "Miss Nora L Gardner from an 'Acquaintance' Evansville Ind 4th July 1863." The song laments a lost love from the woman's point of view and says to "Go, and smile upon another, Kneel and worship at her shrine, Win her heart: then coldly break it, As you would have broken mine."
The University of Tennessee Libraries (Knoxville, Tennessee) is the digital publisher.

titleInfo.title: Digital Collection: The Growth of Democracy in Tennessee: A Grassroots Approach to Volunteer Voices
